contents.data: Unique Variants Manager offers merchants who sell items that are unique but share many characteristics a way to manage these items as variants of a parent item. This method of product management is optimal for these types of products as it allows copy that would otherwise be, well, copied and pasted between these items to be defined on the parent product while information unique to each variant is stored in a metafield on each variant. Unique Variants Manager provides tools that let merchants:

data: Manage groups of similar-but-unique products as variants of a parent product
Improve SEO by grouping products under a single shared url
Have variants be automatically deleted after purchase
Let customers browse variants visually using the Unique Variant Picker app block
Dynamically update product page text in their online store based on the currently selected variant with the Unique Variant Info app block

contents.data: Products with the tag 'unique variants' will appear in the Products List on the home page of the app.

data.altText: Screenshot of products list page
data.caption: Products List page

contents.data: To search for products not listed, click 'Search products' at the top of the Products list. This will open a product search modal where you can find any active product in your store.

data.altText: Screenshot of product search modal
data.caption: Product search modal

contents.data: For a product to be used as a parent product, it needs to have only one (if any) options defined. Opening the page of a product that does not meet this requirement will cause the product conversion prompt to appear. When a product is converted, all of its existing variants are deleted and the product is updated with the 'unique variants' tag so that it will appear in the Products List. If you choose not to accept the conversion, nothing will be changed and you will be returned to the home page of the app.

data.altText: Screenshot of product info page with product conversion prompt open
data.caption: Product Info page with product conversion prompt open

contents.data: Information about a product, including its name, description, tags, and a list of variants, can be viewed on the product's Product Info page. You can navigate to a product's Product Info page by clicking it in the Products List or by selecting it in the product search modal.

data.altText: Screenshot of product info page
data.caption: Example Product Info page

contents.data: Product information can be updated on the Product Edit page. You can navigate to a product's Product Edit page by selecting the Edit quick action that appears when hovering over a product's list entry in the Products List or by selecting the Edit action at the top of the product's info card on the product's Product Info page

data.altText: Screenshot of product edit page
data.caption: Example Product Edit page

contents.data: A list of variants for a particular product can be viewed on the product's Product Info page. Clicking any variant's entry in this list will navigate you to the variant's Variant Info page. Clicking the Edit quick action for a variant will navigate you to that variant's edit page. Clicking the Delete quick action for a variant will open a prompt to delete the selected variant.

data.altText: Screenshot showing variants list on product info page
data.caption: Example variants list card

contents.data: Additionally, a preview of the first three of a product's variants can be viewed by opening the Variants Preview section of a product list item in the Products List on the home page of the app.

data.altText: Screenshot showing variants preview section for a product
data.caption: Example Variants Preview section

contents.data: To create a new variant, click the 'Create new variant' button in the top right corner of the Variants list on the product info page of the parent product.

data.altText: Screenshot of variants list with create new variant button highlighted
data.caption: Create new variant button

contents.data: This will open the New Variant form. Fill out the variant's data and click create.

data.altText: Screenshot of new variant form
data.caption: New Variant form

contents.data: Information about a variant can be viewed on the Variant Info page.

data.altText: Screenshot of variant info page
data.caption: Example Variant Info page

contents.data: To navigate to a variant's Variant Info page, click the list item of the variant in the Variants list on its parent product's Product Info page.
In addition, you can also navigate to a variant's Variant Info page from the Variants Preview section of its parent product's Products List item by clicking the 'View' quick action.

data.altText: Screenshot of variant's view quick action
data.caption: Click 'View' on the parent element's Products List item for a shortcut to its Variant Info page.

contents.data: To edit a variant, click the 'Edit' button at the top of its Variant Info page.

data.altText: Screenshot of edit button on variant info page.
data.caption: Click 'Edit' at the top of the variant's Variant Info page to open the Variant Edit form.

contents.data: This will open the Variant Edit form. Make the desired changes, then click 'Update'.

data.altText: Screenshot of the variant edit form.
data.caption: Example Variant Edit form

contents.data: You can also open a variant's Variant Edit form by clicking the 'Edit' quick action in either the Variants list card on the parent product's Product Info page or in the Variants Preview section of the parent product's list item in the Products List.

data.altText: Split screenshot of the edit quick actions in the Variants list on a product info page and the variants preview section.
data.caption: The 'Edit' quick action can be found on the variant's list item in the Variants list card on the parent product's Product Info page (top) and the parent product's Variants Preview section in the Products List (bottom).

contents.data: To delete a variant, select the 'Delete' button at the top of the variant's Variant Info page. This will open the Confirm Delete modal. In the Confirm Delete modal, Click 'Delete' to proceed and delete the variant, or click 'Cancel' to go back.

data.altText: Screenshot of the variant info page with the delete button highlighted.
data.caption: Click the 'Delete' button on a variant's Variant Info page to delete it.

data.altText: Screenshot of the confirm delete modal
data.caption: The Confirm Delete modal

contents.data: A variant can also be deleted by selecting the 'Delete' quick action on the variant's list item in the Variants list on the parent product's Product Info page.

data.altText: Screenshot of the delete quick action button.
data.caption: Another way to delete a variant is by clicking the 'Delete' quick action on the variant's list item in the Variants list.

contents.data: You can choose to have a variant deleted after it is purchased by enabling the 'Delete after purchase' option. Selecting this option will cause all data about the variant, including the linked product image, to be deleted when an order is created that includes the variant.

data.altText: Screenshot of the delete after purchase checkbox on the variant edit page.
data.caption: Example Variant Edit form with 'Delete after purchase' selected.

contents.data: The Unique Variants Info app block is used to display information about the currently selected variant on the product page.

data.altText: Screenshot of Unique Variants Info block in use on a product page
data.caption: An example of the Unique Variants Info block in use on a product page

contents.data: This app block is meant to replace the default product page description block. It displays only the description for the parent product when there is no variant selected and can display the name and description of a variant when it is selected.

If selected, the description from the parent product is always shown and variant information appears below it when a variant is selected. When unselected, the parent product description disappears and is entirely replaced by the information of the selected variant.

The Unique Variants Picker app block displays a grid of thumbnail images of a product's variants allowing users to browse variants visually.

data.altText: Screenshot of Unique Variants Picker block in use on a product page
data.caption: An example of the Unique Variants Info block in use on a product page

contents.data: Customers can select a variant they're interested in by clicking its thumbnail image. A border is added to each thumbnail image when the customer hovers over it to provide feedback. The thumbnail image of the selected variant has a border at all times.
Sets the number of columns in the thumbnail grid

data.altText: Screenshot of a thumbnail grid with 2 columns.
data.caption: A thumbnail grid with two columns

contents.data: Adjusts the space between thumbnail images
Adjusts the width of each thumbnail image. Note: Since thumbnail images are square, this also adjusts the height.
Adjusts the thickness of the border that appears on the thumbnail image of the selected variant and on each thumbnail on mouse hover.

data.altText: Screenshot of a thumbnail grid with a border around a thumbnail and a line indicating the width.
data.caption: Demonstration of border width

contents.data: Sets the color of the border that appears on the thumbnail image of the selected variant and on each thumbnail on mouse hover.
Sets maximum height of the thumbnail grid before it becomes scrollable.
Decides which part of the product image will be kept if the image becomes cropped. Note: To prevent cropping, use square product images
The scrollbar settings adjust the appearance of the scrollbar element that appears when the thumbnail grid's height exceeds the Thumbnail grid max height setting.

Scrollbar settings may produce different results depending on the browser used. Please test in multiple browsers for best results. Certain scrollbar settings are only applicable to Webkit browsers such as Chrome and Safari. These settings are marked as 'Webkit only'.
